meanings.sent1: I miscounted the candies in the jar and thought there were more than there actually were.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to miscount the number of books on the shelf.
meanings.sent3: My little sister tends to miscount her toys, always thinking she has more than she does.
meanings.sent4: She miscounted the steps and stumbled on the last one, almost falling.
meanings.sent5: The cashier's miscount of the change led to confusion at the register.

meanings.sent1: The miscount of votes caused a delay in announcing the winner.
meanings.sent2: Please double-check your inventory to avoid any miscounts.
meanings.sent3: The miscount of sheep made the bedtime story even more amusing.
meanings.sent4: The miscount of stars in the sky reminded her of how vast the universe is.
meanings.sent5: The miscount in the recipe resulted in a cake that was too sweet.
